Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: These headphones are great! Sound quality is crisp and clear, and the bass in on-point. Great for all genres! Absolutely no pressure on your ears, even after hours of use. And it's very stylish!
Cons: The price of course...I mean they're terrific headphones, but not for the price. You can get headphones with same quality for around $150-ish. They also leak sound if the sound is too high, which is isn't a problem for some, but it can get annoying.
No others. :)

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: In-line mic, sound quality, style, durabilty, doesn't take batteries or leak
Cons: Nothing
I've heard a lot of people saying how these headphones aren't very durable and, therefore, break easily. I disagree. These are much sturdier than I thought they would be. They have great sound quality as well. The bass is pretty precise and has a nice punch to it. It can hit the lows as well as the highs. I've also heard that these don't have much, if any, treble. They do have treble, but it's not the best. That's the only downside to these headphones. But, for the price of $200, these cannot be beat.
If you're considering buying either these or the Studios, take this into consideration. The Solos are much lighter, don't take batteries, have the in-line mic, fit a little ti ... ghter on your head so you can move around without them falling off, have great sound quality, and are also quite durable despite what some people say. The Studios, on the other hand, have absolutely amazing sound quality, but they take batteries and leak like crazy. It all depends on what you're going to be using them for and where you'll be listening to them. The Solos barely leak. They can hardly be heard from 3 feet away when the volume is half way up. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: excuse my language, but these are SEXY
Item.Review:
Pros: the sound quality, the style they look freaking sweet, the looks you get from people :DDD
Cons: the high price. better case would be nice....
i'm not even joking. first of all they sound totally sweet. they are good sound quality. they're beats what do you expect. the price is a bit high but you get what you pay for. they look totally sick. the headphonjes sound GREAT. perfect bass perfect everything they fit snug on your head and they are super durable. you dont think these are durable? trust me. or trust this youtube video which shows a durability test
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZfXX0Sm_OpA
the headband is super durable and i even tried this on my own solos. they DO NOT BREAK. these are perfect. the noise reduction is perfect and the beats are jus ... t downright sexy....
get these you wont regret it. seriously.....best headphones ive ever had. love them and i will use them forever....ahaha. no joke. i get looks from all my friends because they know these are the sickest new headphones and they envy me expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: if you love your music....get these!
Item.Review:
Pros: sound quality is great
do not be mislead into thinking that the Dr. Dre name implies made for rap music. i am a heavy metal/rock fan.....along with latin jazz/salsa and others. the deep bass and crisp highs are very nicely balanced. i like being able to unplug the cable from the headphones as well as from my mp3 player and having track and volume control on the cable was a must for me as well. you get what you pay for and i feel these are worth the higher price.....they are higher end equipment in my opinion. if you are looking for something to workout in, i would stay with good earbuds because headphones limit the head from breathing and i personally don't like extra sweat and heat buildup.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: Good sound, not so good quality!
Item.Review: They sound great and are what we expected. However where you expand them to fit your head one side is loose and doesn't stay where you want it. Also after just 2 days of use the cord broke where it meets the headphones. My friends broke in the exact same spot! Quality issue?? I'm still trying to get ahold of their customer service department. I have called twice and both times I sat and waited for over 20 minutes to get someone to talk to. I dont have time to wait! For the price I expected a LOT more.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Stylish; Good Bass; Comfortable; Compact; Great Sound; Good Value; Lightweight; Durable
Really nice. I have this and the STUDIO's. Good product. Although this is good, I would recommend the STUDIO's but the price is about $300.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Great sound, thumping bass, comfort, looks
Cons: Nothing.
I first purchased the Beats Studio headphones in black, and using them with the iPhone 4, I felt they were under powered. I returned those for the Bose - OE headphones. These sounded great on the demo display, but again, sounded like they were struggling to put out any volume. I returned those for the Beats Solo HD Red and was immediately impressed with the comfort, sound quality and volume. The bass is strong without overpowering the mids and highs and I have worn them for over four hours at a time and have almost forgotten they were on my head. I have not had any issues with durability. After I use the headphones, I carefully fold them and place them in their case. I did purchase the product replacement plan ju ... st in case. I definitely would recommend these headphones. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: Sound Decent but the Bose still sound better.
Item.Review:
Pros: looks cool , remote works the shuffle 3rd gen
Cons: leaky & compressed sound , bose sounds better for less money .
i have owned the bose over the ear for about a year and just picked up the beats solo hd in red. i have tried all types of music the last two days and did side by side with the bose, and the bose have better bass and midrange than the beats. i think the main reason is the bose fits air tight and the beats leaks a lot of sound. The bose has a lot more spacious sound and the beats sounds compressed. i do like the built in control on the beats , works the shuffle 3rd gen just like the factory remote but with the bose the belkin adapater works fine too and i like the belkin cause it moves the buttons low, just on top of the shuffle. oh well i like to try ne ... w things, but the bose over the ear for $50.00 sound better, but thumbs up for the look and the remote on the beats solo hd. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Great sound and design.
Cons: Not great for working out. Lots of movement when sweaty.
Great headphones. I wear them while working out. Comfortable fit but tend to slide off when sweaty.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Bass, sound, fit
Cons: Durability
Originally I bought the $300 Beats because they were the hottest thing out there. Being a girl (and a small one) made that difficult though since those headphones were very obviously designed with men in mind. They were too heavy and too big to be comfortable. So with that in mind I decided to give the Solo a try.
Now, they make two different varieties of the Solo. They have the standard and then they have these HD version. I love the red color, so I went with the special edition for that reason. I've listened to the standards and to be honest I can't hear a bit of difference between the two.
The sound quality is pretty awesome. The bass really does sound out in these headphones. I do notice that some of the lyrics and som ... e of the less bass-filled music does seem a bit muffled (but not enough to notice unless you're listening to high quality sound all the time in your car and home).
The fit is a bit tight, but that's better for the noise isolation. It also helps since these headphones are still a bit on the heavy side from what people are normally used to. If they didn't grip your head then they'd fall off and break.
Durability is the biggest problem with every pair of expensive headphones on the market. These are no exception. The bridge between the headphones is especially fragile. When you take them off, you can't just pull on one side like you would with a cheapy pair. I've yet to walk into a Best Buy and see a pair of these not snapped in half. That being said... twenty dollars get you a service plan that covers your headphones if they break.
Overall these are not as powerful as their big brother. But for people of smaller stature, they are a perfect fit in both sound and build. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Noise isolation
Cons: Perfect ear fit but very manageable
This was a replacement of my AIWA noise cancelling headset (over 8 years old) which crumbled in flight last year. Originally went in for Bose but listened to Beats also. Selected the Solo (noise isolation/on-the-ear) instead of noise cancelling/over-the-ear because the sound was just as good and cheaper. Shields out noise just as well as the over-the-ear noise cancelling. However, if you can afford the over-the-ear style, it is more comfortable but larger profile. Also, your headset is not pressing the outer ear which you may not be used to. The Solo is unbelievable sound no matter what you plug it into!

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: style sound and comfort
Cons: haven't discover any yet
Well if anyone's looking at reviews wondering if they're worth its price, I would say its worth every penny. 200 bucks for some headphones are pricey but you will pay for what you get!! These headphones produce very well balanced sounds. The highs, med's and lows are balance throughout. The Bass on these are great as well. I'm a person into sounds when it comes to music and I was debating between Beats and Bose. Both are great headphones, just preference. Beats are highly recommended if anyone is looking for a well balanced sound. Cheap headphones sends out unbalanced frequency but these are balanced!! The vocals not as crispy as the Bose but these produce a "normal" sound when it comes vocals and that's what I like ... about them. Like I said, its just preference. You can hear the artists vocals naturally with no extra crisps or adjustments to your equalizer. They're not 100% noise cancelling. Enough to keep the music in your ears but can still hear a slight touch around your surroundings (Depending how loud you have them on too). As for the comfort, they are comfortable. Not too heavy on your head either. I chose these solos over the pros because the pros seems to be too heavy on the head. Plus, the pros are for studio recording purposes and if you aren't recording, there isn't a reason to purchase them. But recommend these headphones if you want real quality!! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quailty/ design
Cons: Nothing
What do you get once you combine style and amazing sound quailty? You get Beats By Dr Dre head phones! I got these headphones... Just to see what the big deal was with them.. One listen with these headphones on and I couldn't put them down. I read reviews about the headphones like you are doing and they were all possitive comments! For headphones as good as these, The pricing is set right. One phrase to describe these headphones... An amazing combination of bass and treble.. Designed simple and elegant.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything!
Cons: N/A
So i just bought these since I already have the beats by dre tour and let me tell you these are the bomb! I did not want to get them at first because they are over the ear but I am happy I did! The sound is amazing! These are well worth the price! I will never buy any other brand of headphones that is not BEATS by DR DRE. I listen to every kind of music and they do not dissapoint, even the movies on my iPod sound amazing!!!! The bass is outstanding!

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Headphones for a Great Cause!
Item.Review:
Pros: Looks; Music Quality
Cons: Price
Overall, these headphones deliver clear music, with nice thumping low-end to add a kind of excitement to the music. They make you want to listen to every song in your library just to see how the music will sound on the Beats Solos. Also, these are some killer looking headphones. At first I thought they seemed kind of toy-like, but the more time I spent with the headphones, I realized that the design and the sound were built to last without becoming outdated. These will still be "cool" 3 years from now. They also come with a ControlTalk cable which I make phone calls on and have never had any complaints about sound quality. The cable, while not 'tangle-free' has never became tangled as it is so much thicker than an average headphone cable ... , and also detachable. There might be better headphones out there, but I've never heard or seen them, so in the end they make up for the high price tag. Go ahead and get these. Not only do they sound great, though, but they also go to a great cause! End AIDS in Africa! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review: Bought these headphones for my son and I'm still getting - THANKS MOM! Sound quality is excellent and clear. AllowS you to hear the words and the music with such clarity, did you really know what the singer was saying with those other headphones??? Still cautious about the reviews I read about them snapping, so we'll wait and see on that issue. Overall - EXCELLENT!

you really hear the bass when you are listening to them.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Bass, overall sound quality.
Cons: After a while they become uncomfortable.
This is my first pair of "nice" headphones, and I love them! They are everything I could really ask for. They have GREAT bass & sound quality. And they aren't really "flimsy" like some may say. I would definitely recommend these to anyone who wants to hear music in a whole new way. It really made a difference!

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: Good headphones, hurt ears after wearing for while
Item.Review:
Pros: Great sound, and look
Cons: hurts the ears.
This is my first pair of headphones, and I am satisfied with them. The design is nice and appealing, and they aren't too bulky. The cushions on the ears are nice at first, but after a while they hurt the ears. At least they hurt mine. But overall a great product.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: Great headphones. The best I ever had.
Item.Review:
Pros: Sounds great, able to use with phone, detachable, quality, able to control volume, forward and backward tracks.
Cons: Can not think of any flaws.
Best headphones ever. I love how you can answer the phone, control volume, tracks, play, pause etc. comfortable. Stylish. Quality sound. Detachable which avoids the wires from shorting out. Works very well with Apple Products. Able to fold in nice bag. Fits well while working out (running).

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: you get what you pay for....... $200
Item.Review:
Pros: Lightweight and very stylish
Cons: little uncomfortable after a while
I was blown away on how great these headphones were. I travel a lot so I need a pair of good portable headphones that will last. These headphones were perfect for my needs and they just recently reinforced the head band to make it more durable. Also if your worried about durability then buy a stand for your beats. When you fold and unfold the the hinges get looser and looser and after a while they will break. So pre adjust the headband to your fit and hang them up so you minimize folding them.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: A little expensive but worth it...
Item.Review:
Pros: They sound great!!
Cons: They do not stay in place very well
I bought these to use in the office and when I fly trying to cut down on the background noise. The work great in the office I cannot hear anyone, on the plan not so much. The background noise when you are flying is a little more than in my office but it does cut it way down so overall I am pleased. I should point out that these are NOT marketed noise canceling and I am using them as noise canceling. I will probably get a set for my daughter and she will absolutely be getting the warranty.
I have heard that they tend to break so I bought the warranty, which means they will probably never break. For the little bit it cost I would recommend getting the warranty just to be safe.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:

The sound is amazing and style is cool. Definitely plan on adding more Dr Dre Beats to my collection.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: The best value for your money
Item.Review:
Pros: all around great deal for the price
Cons: nothing
I received these headphones as a gift over a year ago, and to this day I still use them daily. The music is incredibly clear, and the bass is tight and accurate. They do a great job at noise cancelling, I work in a loud environment and all I can hear is my music loud and clear.
Control talk is also another great feature of these. I am able to switch seamlessly from my music to a call without any awkward fumbling of my phone.
All in all, an amazing value. If these ever fail me, I will replace them with the same model promptly.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Simple and easy to use for an incredible result.
Cons: The noise cancellation and sound block you off from those around you, but often, thats what you want.
I have always loved listening to music, but these Beats have made everything so much better. The sound quality is amazing and I wear them for hours on end and they are still comfortable. They are a bit pricey but its very worth if you are into your music. I take these with me almost everywhere, they are very convenient. The sound these things put out is incredible, I hear parts of songs I've never heard before and with the noise cancellation, its like I'm in my own private music room where ever I wear them. The people around me are often out of luck if they want my attention, which isn't so great, but the music is w ... orth it. They are in good shape and I use mine for hours everyday, but I've only had them a month, so I will have to see how they endure. So far I am incredibly impressed and recommend these to everyone I know. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red

All I ask is to go to real audiophile forums and ask what they think about this headphone. That is my review.
Save yourself. If you want style, comfort and sound, get Skullcandy Aviators.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Style, sound quality.
Cons: Nothing, if you like the over-ear style.
We purchased these for my wife.She uses them in the gym & flights and finds them comfotable for fairly long (length of movie) time. I was very pleased with the sound quality - balanced, and fold up ok into the travel case (included). I really liked the cable disconnects completely so you don't accidently snap it off and if the cable has issues - easy to replace. My wife also likes the bright red colour.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Style, quality
Cons: price
I have been wanting these headphones for such a long time, but didn't want to spend the money. My husband took me to Best Buy to pick out my birthday gift & I immediately went for these. We tried out the Bose & all of the others available to use. The Beats are the best, by a mile. The sound is fuller & there are things going on in music that we have been missing! I am forever hearing extra beats & sounds that I never heard before. I use these on airplanes, when I'm out in public, and in bed when my husband is sleeping. Now I want Beats speakers in our iPad, iPods, cars, TVs, etc. These are awesome. I got the Solos, for one because I didn't want to spend the extra to get the higher-end ones, but also, I honestly think these are ... the most comfortable & sound the best. I have not used them at the gym yet, as they are a little bulky for that. I use some cheap ones there, but otherwise these are perfect! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review: I just bought these today and I got to say they are BEAST. First of all, the bass on these things at phenomenal! They look great, they sound great, and they feel great on my head. If u are looking for some headphones with great bass and that sound then these are for you. I would have to say that these headphones are more for people who listen to rap an hip-hop like me. I have some Cobra Starship and David Guetta in my iTunes library and they sound the same as you would hear in like normal headphones. But when listened to Dre's hit Kush and Forget About Dre they sounded amazing. It made me feel like I was in the studio with him. Overall these headphones are great!

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Sound: Bass, Highs, Lows, etc.
Item.Review:
Pros: Stylish, sturdy, light, multiple wires for listening, great all around.
Cons: Absolutely NOTHING!
I love these headphones so much, the sound is better than ANYTHING I have ever used! They are a little pricey but that's because the sound incredible, and they DO NOT disappoint. I don't know how people say that they sound bad or are cheap, because they are wrong. They are very durable, and great quality.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound Quality and Style
Cons: Nothing
These headphones are amazing. The sound quality is the best ive ever heard in my life. Its so comfortable, after a while it feels like nothings there. I've heard people say the beats snap too easily. The Solo's are the ones that break easily, after complaints and stuff like that, they made new beats with flexible and more durable plastic called Solo HD.
Also. GET THE WARRANTY. its only an extra $30. If anything might happen to it, best buy will fix it up or replace them with new ones
So yeah. Worth the Price! GET EM'!

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: Great headphones, but don't be dumb with them
Item.Review:
Pros: Sounds and Control Talk feature
Cons: I see more people at the gym with them.
I really love these headphones because the sound is decent and the control talk feature is super convenient at the gym. If you work out at the gym and have people asking you things all the time, you can just pause tracks w/ control talk. No need to take the head phones off your ear. I don't need to fumble in my shorts to access the iPod to change tracks or adjust volume; control talk lets you do that.
I travel a lot and these headphones are awesome on the plane. They don't have noise cancelling, but they do a good job. I've got some noise cancelling phillips which work better, but you won't be dissapointed on the plane with these beats. They'll do the job and you'll hear everything in t ... he song or movie.
What sucks (at no fault of the headphones) is the compatibility with my cell phone. I wish my Samsung Epic 4G worked with the control talk feature like an iphone, blackberry or my wifes EVO does. The music still plays with my phone, but I can't answer phone calls, change tracks, or adjust volume with the control talk feature. Thus I take my iPod to the gym.
When I first got these headphones, I was the only dude at the gym with them, but now I'm seeing more people with them which kind of takes away that exclusivity of them.
I'm on my third set. My first one's broke after a few months. The piece in with the beat logo popped out. Didn't work properly after. It was okay because I had the best buy warranty. Had them replaced the next day and even upgraded to the HD (first ones were Solo, not Solo HD). They're strong but not indestructible. I wear them to the gym all the time and they handle it well.
I strongly advise that you purchase the best buy warranty with these. Its worth it for the price you're investing in these headphones. Why deal with Monster when you can just roll into your local best buy and swap them out immediately. I hope this info helps. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red

i love this headphones, the sound quality is great best i have ever had,i had the apple headphones before. comparing does with this, this are amazing, they are a little pricey, the the construction is a little flimsy, but i know how to take care of this type of stuff, they are very comfortable for me, i would recommend you to go wear them in Best Buy, because we all have different head and ears and it might be uncomfortable for you. overall i would rate this 5 stars.

I bought these earlier today and they are the best headphones I've ever bought, BY FAR! They are so comfortable and the bass on these things is SICK!! Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: The sound quality
Cons: The metal on plastic ear cup hinges.
I tried this headphones and they hurt my ears. The hinges that hold the ear cups are metal on plastic that makes afraid that they will not last very long and $200 plus is to much to lose, the Studio HD hinges are metal on metal. The sound quality is great but they are not the Studio HD ones which is the ones that I ended up with.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality, durability, portability for over-the-ear headphones
Cons: small ear-pieces
This is my first pair of over-the-ear headphones and I have been more than thrilled. The size, compared to the larger Beats, is much more portable but is not as comfortable. Because of the smaller ear pieces, it does not cover the entire ear which can cause some discomfort if you are wearing them for a long period of time. It is great having the iPhone connectivity option and the two different lengths in cords. Overall I love these!

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Bass; Great Sound; Stylish
Cons: Not for travel bulky; Headache; Uncomfortable; Falls Off/Out Of Ear; Not for exercise
It gives me a headache after 3-4 hours. I can't exercise with this, it falls off constantly. I can't use it most of the time, because I'm on the go most of my day, and it falls off. Although the sound is good, but I have to return this product.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review: Theese headphones have great quality. They are not waterproof so be careful in the rain. The sound is amazing and they block out all background noise. I have used them when I'm working with a jackhammer and didn't hear it at all.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red

These are great headphones...the sound is great. The only thing that sounds bad on them is when you go to put them on your head and they SNAP like a popcicle stick. The other thing that sounds bad is when you call MONSTER and find out the warranty doesn't cover it. These guys are criminal...there's probably $15 worth of material in these, yet they won't cover a warranty?? c'mon. MONSTER is horrible.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red

I love music, and I can't be without it. I wanted to invest in some good quality headphones. I first thought of buying another brand names because they gave the sound proof benefit, then I tried this beats solo's and not only do they block any outside sound, but the sound quality you get is unbelievable.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: To big for my liking but the sound is awesome
Item.Review:
Pros: the sound quality
Cons: bulky for everyday travel
I got these after the Beats Tour wouldn't stay right in my ears. These are nice for sitting around listening to music but I feel like I'm wearing earmuffs. After extended wear they begin to hurt my ears but the sound quality is amazing. Im not a big fan of big headphones but these are nice. I love the color and as long as you take care of them they will last. I like that the wire comes out and they can be changed to be used as the remote. I can't turn these all the way up because its to loud but they really do sound great and if your a fan of big headphones with the most incredible bass then these will be right for you.
On an off note, the case it comes with is rather great. I use to be really bad about keeping th ... em in the case but these are worth keeping in the case. expand » « collapse

beats headphones are great but all of them sound the same. I dont like the build of these headphones but overall quality is great.

I think that they have pimpen' sound quality. They have enhanced my music listening quality with their rich tones.

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: Best headphones I have ever had!
Item.Review:
Pros: Music Quality; Looks
Cons: Price
These are the best headphones I have ever owned, the quality and the looks and everything about theses headphones are amazing. I have had the headphones for about 6 months and have listen to music differently ever since that day, when you buy a song on iTunes and listen to it, it will amaze you. use the product mainly at home and on a car ride. If you are trying to buy this, just know that you will be disappointed. They are definitely not worth the money, but if you value looking cool, then yes get them. They are great as they have the new improved headband. However, after 20-30 mins of using it, your ears start hurting from pressure, and also sweating will suck. Finger prints are also likely to occur but are not as bad as some other pr ... oducts.These are the best headphones I have ever tried and used before, these destroy the music quality of Apple and other companies! I will never go back to my old headphones! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.ReviewTitle: Beats sound and comfort, but cheap build quality
Item.Review:
Pros: sound quality, comfort
Cons: cheapness of parts
These headphones are very good, they deliver beats quality sound for a much more affordable price, what i mean is that your getting beats studio quality sound for a much cheaper price. They have very powerful bass, but like i said in my studios review, it is a little more than i could take, but with an equalizer it can be changed to make it powerful but not overpowering. Mids are crisp and defined, but they do fall far behind the mids and highs, you will find out that these headphones were defiantly meant for rap, hip hop, but nothing that would really involve a guitar or something with mid frequency sound. Highs are surprisingly good, they are warm and rich, but can be sharp at times if the voice of the singer becomes ver ... y distorted with the use of audio equipment. Comfort is also a plus, since they are on ear headphones you have to take into consideration how much pressure is put on your ears, and these put very little on your ears, so they are very comfortable for long periods of time. only problem i have with the headphones is that they are made up of extremely cheap items, i took them out of the box and put them on my head, had to take them off once to make dinner, and put them on again to listen to some music before bed and when i took them off they snapped into three pieces!!! Once you get these headphones you will find out that they are meant to be the cheap version of the studios, because they took away all of the fancy gadgetry's and made all of the plastic cheap and easy to break. the box comes with a plush carrying case since these headphones fold up for minimun storage space taken up, and a replacable audio cable so that you can replace it if it breaks, but i doubt you could break the cable before the headphones do. Overall these headphones are just cheap and break easy, but if you absolutly need beats quality sound then go for it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review: Never tried them but whatever, I'm just saying try out the ATH-WS70 Solid Bass Over-Ear Headphones by Audio-Technica they are nice and are perfectly good headphones.

They look amazing but are horrible quality in every way. Get Bose. They are worth the money.

Item.ReviewTitle: Good if you want to keep buying the 2 year protect
Item.Review:
Pros: sound,confort
Cons: Durability,none at all
I owned the 1st pair 5 months before the started failing apart,the cushion on top,so I returned them,paid $40 for another pair,because I like the protection plan,made it 3 months with the 2nd pair,and the left earphone was crackling,so mad.Had to return those,and I was sick of paying $40 every 4 to 6 months,so I went the Bose Quiet Comfort way,much happier,even E-mailed Beats about it,never heard a thing back,GRRRR

Item.Item: Monster Beats Solo HD (PRODUCT)RED with ControlTalk - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural - Red
Item.Review:
Pros: everything promised is true
Cons: fingerprint magnet
I've had these headphones for under a day at this point, and I love them! I've wanted a pair since I tried them over a year ago at my local Bestbuy and have been saving up since college ended this year. I love how it comes with two seperate cables, and how they remove from the headset itself. This removes the problem of wires going dead that I have had in the past. I will still use my cheaper headphones for exersice and when in shady areas at school, but these will be my must have for studying and writing.
